definitions.definition: that can be done; that will be successful

examples.text: If there was any delay then the rescue plan would cease to be viable.
It is only their investment that makes the project economically viable.
None of the projects proved financially viable.
a perfectly viable form of political organization
I'm afraid that is just not a viable option.
Once the company is commercially viable, we should be able to invest more.

definitions.definition: capable of developing and surviving independently

wordOrigin: early 19th cent.: from French, from vie ‘life’, from Latin vita.
